author: Jordan Davies
title: Ajax star Justin Kluivert wants to follow in dad Patrick’s footsteps and join Barcelona
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments Ajax teenage sensation Justin Kluivert has admitted that he would love to follow in his father’s footsteps and become a Barcelona great in the future. 
The 17-year-old – son of Dutch legend Patrick – has already made a name for himself in his native homeland with the Eredivise giants after signing his first professional contract with the club this year. Getty Images Justin Kluivert is becoming one of Europe’s most exciting and promising young talents Getty Images 7 Kluivert is hoping to become a Barcelona great in the future just like his father 
And even though his footballing career is in its infancy, Kluivert is already looking towards the future, hoping to emulate his father should he be given the chance to play at the Nou Camp, and is even considering a move to England also. 
Speaking to Goal , Kluivert said: “ Barcelona is my dream club. Within seven years, I would like to be at Barcelona. 
“But before that I would like to play in England as well. I really like that competition [the Premier League] and I would like to play there.” Reuters Patrick Kluivert made his name as a world class player at Barcelona, winning the title in 1999 Reuters 7 Kluivert joined Newcastle United in 2004 under Sir Bobby Robson but only stayed for one season 
Justin’s father Patrick moved to Barcelona in 1997, and went on to score 90 goals in 182 La Liga games, winning the title with the Catalans in 1999. 
He too spent time in the Premier League, moving to Newcastle United for the 2004/05 season, making 25 appearances. Getty Images Justin Kluivert is slowly developing at Ajax alongside a successful youth set-up Getty Images 7 Kluivert looks up to Cristiano Ronaldo who has made a career as one of the worlds greatest at Madrid 
Despite his dream being to move to Barcelona, Justin admitted that the player that inspires him the most is the star of their rivals Real Madrid . 
“I look up to Cristiano Ronaldo ,” he said. 
“Not just because of his qualities, which are obvious, but also the way he lives and eats and how hard he trains. He is really an example for me.” Getty Images 7 Kluivert is now director of football at Paris Saint-Germain, but his son won’t be following him to France 
His father Patrick is currently the director of football at French giants Paris Saint-Germain , but Justin has insisted that there are no plans to make it a family affair at the Parc des Princes. 
“No, no, no, we haven’t spoken about that,” Justin said. 
“Of course, sometimes we joke about that, but it doesn’t go further than joking!” Lionel Messi celebrates Barcelona's incredible comeback against PSG
